## Introduction

Quarto documents do contain code cells. This code cell loads the `palmerpenguins` package.

```{r packages}
#load packages
library(palmerpenguins)
```

Code cells are like R script snippets. They can be interspersed throughout your Quarto document.

```{r data, include=FALSE}
#save data to object
penguins <- palmerpenguins::penguins
```

I can then add text inbetween the code cells that I can format using markdown syntax - similarly to what I would do in a Word document.

The *code cell* below displays the **first six rows** of the `penguins` data set.

```{r preview}
#View first six rows of data
head(penguins)
```
